title: Citi Russia: Microfinance Improves the Financial Well-Being of Russians

tag-1: Citi Russia: Microfinance Improves the Financial Well-Being of Russians
tag-2: Moscow – Citi Russia hosted a briefing on "The Social Impacts of Microfinancing: Myths or Reality?" Mikhail Mamuta, President of the Russian Microfinance Center (RMC), presented the results of a study on the influence of microfinance on the lives of low-income clients. The study assessed indicators in a variety of areas related to both business and family.
tag-3: The results of the study, which was carried out by RMC and Citi Foundation, confirmed that microfinancing plays an important social role. Ninety percent of respondents noted higher business profitability as a result of using the services of microfinance organizations, 55 percent reported an increase in assets, 36 percent – job creation, and 30 percent – expansion of business geography. Sixty-eight percent of microfinance clients reported higher household income as a result of receiving micro-loans for business development.
tag-4: Additionally, more than half of the respondents (51 percent) noted that funds received from microfinance organizations created opportunities for them to access the services of larger financial institutions.
tag-5: For clients of microfinance organizations, growth of key indicators was higher than for entrepreneurs who did not make use of such services. At the end of the crisis (in 2010), 61 percent of clients reported growth in profit, while among those who did not make use of microloans, only 22 percent reported growth.
tag-6: Microfinance organizations have the most visible impact on clients with limited access to bank borrowing opportunities, such as microbusinesses, women, low-income people and residents of small towns.
tag-7: Microfinancing had a greater impact on raising the household income of clients in regional towns and rural areas than those in regional capitals (57 percent to 73 percent).
tag-8: Families of entrepreneurs with low income levels demonstrated a higher rate of success in raising their social status than those whose financial situation was already at a more moderate level (28 percent to 47 percent).
tag-9: Microbusinesses with one to three workers were more likely to report that microfinancing helped them feel more confident in their finances than small businesses with a greater number of employees. Seventy-five percent of the former and 61 percent of the latter reported experiencing this effect.
tag-10: Women who used the services of microfinance organizations expand their role in the management of their own assets and in family planning. Among the clients of microfinance organizations, the gender of the "heads" of the households was evenly balanced, whereas among non-clients men were twice as often reported to fulfill this role.
tag-11: "The results of the study show that classic microfinancing is primarily aimed at supporting low-income people and residents of rural areas," noted Mikhail Mamuta. "Lacking other sources of financing, it is the services of the microfinance organizations which help develop emerging businesses. This means that the development of microfinancing for business could help accomplish important social tasks – the development of the middle class and realization of citizens' entrepreneurial potential."
tag-12: This is the first time that such a study has been conducted in Russia. The survey's targets included both clients and non-clients of microfinance organizations: entrepreneurs (owners of small and micro enterprises and individual entrepreneurs) and the households of directors of small and micro enterprises and individual entrepreneurs.

tag-17: Russian Microfinance Center  Russian Microfinance Center (RMC) was founded in July 2002 as a response to the clear need of the sector for the organization that would represent the interests of the entire microfinance community. RMC works as a resource center for the microfinance sector as well as a national forum for interaction with the government, community, and investors. RMC facilitates development of the favorable legal framework, provides professional education and consulting services to the microfinance organizations, and promotes introduction of national standards of microfinance operations. For more information see www.rmcenter.ru.
